name: Another build request, this time for a "detective" type of character
author: Krosah

posts.author: Krosah
posts.content:
Hello again, ladies and gents!

With the last build that I received from Empyre, I took it through the OC with a friend and I was super impressed (thanks again Empyre).

This time, I'm trying to build a detective-type Rogue character for said friend (able to investigate well with all of the proper environmental and social skills, so higher-than-normal INT), but I'm having a few issues.  It's DEX-based and dual-wielding, which is fantastic vs single targets, but the main issue is when there're trash mobs; the build is 100% capable of dealing with them but spends a LOT of extra time taking out larger groups of small enemies, either having to take them out one at a time, or stacking a bunch of traps and luring them in.  This is especially prevalent when fighting an undead horde... sneak attack immunity is a problem.

Another issue I'm running into is getting max APR with certain approaches.  The build calls for 4 APR, which means 16+ BAB before lvl 20.  Splashing any Wizard levels with Rogue pre-epic (to take advantage of higher INT for all of the skills in the build, as well as add some versatility) majorly cuts into BAB progression, almost guaranteeing an APR of 3.  The only way I could avoid this was investing at least 8 levels into a warrior class, like Fighter or Ranger, before lvl 20.  Similarly, this means the max amount of Rogue levels before lvl 20 would be 16, with a 4 level warrior splash.

Something else to note is that I've looked at quite a few builds using the search engine.  None of them 100% fit what I'm trying to achieve.  Either they're an APR short or much of the diversity/power comes rather late... I'd rather have the build fully capable across all levels.  If it weren't for these factors, the Ferromancer by Mithdradates would've made an excellent match, especially with the whole Darkness sneak attack cheese.

But anyway, on to the request!  If a build already exists that fits the below criteria that I've missed (quite possible), I apologize in advance:

1) PvM - Like the last build, it'll be going through the OC, expansions, Infinite Dungeons, and newer DLCs (when applicable, starting over at lvl 1), sometimes solo, sometimes not.

2) Level Cap - 40; requesting for build to be fully playable and enjoyable from 1-40 if at all possible.

3) Race Preference - Human.  Keeping it simple.

4) Class Preference - Rogue would fit best with the archetype in question.  As stated above, Wizard wouldn't be a bad mix-in if I could get the BAB issue to work... but really, anything goes.


5) Melee Preference - Dual-wielding, DEX-based, high AC, Epic Dodge if possible but not required.  I don't see a "detective" using a shield or a bow.  Hell, even unarmed would be doable.  I'm also aiming for 16+ BAB by lvl 20 to make sure they get 4 APR.

6) Range Preference - Eh, if they use range, it'll more than likely be in a pinch, so maybe a crossbow for extra damage, or a sling or darts to keep the total equipment weight down.

7) Weapon Preference - Kukris maybe?  Or daggers?  I can't see a "detective" type of character using a two-hander, or even a medium-sized weapon, really.  Something light and easily concealed.

8) Maximum Item Enhancement - It depends on the module being used.  Like the other build, this will be played through all of the officially released content.

9) Spellcasting - None required, but always welcome.

10) Custom Factors - OC, expansions, and DLC constraints.  Also, like the other build, I'm trying to avoid alignment change requirements.  Speaking of alignment, we're aiming for LN; that's the type of character they want to play.

Again, a big thank you in advance for any and all advice given.  It's very much appreciated!  🙂

P.S. For reference, a snippet of the portrait they'll be using is attached, maybe for a bit of inspiration as well.

posts.author: The Flying Rodent
posts.content:
There's a fair bit to break down in your request, so I guess if I were to attempt to summarise it for clarity:

You're after a 'detective' type character, with 'environment and social skills' (which at the very least calls for decent Intelligence), Dexterity focus + Dual Wielding, max APR, and possibly Wizard levels thrown in.

May I recommend ditching the idea of taking Wizard if you're after Max APR on a duel wielding Rogue. Go for either 3 APR + Wizard levels, or 4 APR + No wizard levels. The only way to reconcile the two ideas would be to go something like "Rogue 8  Wizard 4 Fighter 8" pre-epic, and then I guess move into something like "Rogue 13 Wizard 17 Fighter 10" by level 40 ... which would be underwhelming both at melee and at spellcasting.

If you're worried about trash mobs as a duel wielding Rogue, throwing in some Shadowdancer levels can help you a lot, as this will allow you to stealth without having to be hidden behind terrain first. Alternatively, if you fancy taking some Monk levels, you could forgo Shadowdancer in favour of just speedily hiding behind terrain whenever you get into trouble.

Given your description, I'd suggest "Rogue/Shadowdancer/X" as your class combination, perhaps with 16 int, with "X" being a High BAB class of some sort. You could go Rogue/SD/Fighter, Rogue/SD/Ranger, Rogue/SD/CoT, Rogue/SD/Paladin, Rogue/SD/Monk (with kamas), the list goes on.

I quite like Ranger23/Rogue16/SD1 with duel daggers, but if you choose 'the wrong' favoured enemies for a particular environment it can miss out on some damage opportunities. Though for PvM, it's probably safe to just choose 'typically critical hit immune' enemies such as Undead/Constructs/etc.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Rogue is indeed skill points and class skills galore and offers what you need for Epic Dodge.
Monk, Bard and Ranger or Fighter/CoT, all have something to offer. They pull the build in different directions. But they are all viable.

I would not be too keen on BAB 16+ if you want SD and/or a caster class. You can still have a character that can hold his own very well without warrior levels.
There are several ways to build this detective character. Some of our "betters" have already offered some strong builds here.

Bard/Ranger/Rogue is Multiple Attribute Dependent if you want dexterity for ED and AB, intelligence for skills, charisma for bard spellcasting and wisdom for ranger spells. If you also want constitution for being a frontliner and at least some strength for damage against sneak immunes and carrying capacity, the build becomes completely MAD. So you will need a very strict focus with such a class combo.
